channel.title: [eBook] Beginning Programming with Java for Dummies
channel.description:
[img]http://media.wiley.com/product_data/coverImage300/45/07645887/0764588745.jpg[/img]
[ul][li]Covering everything from basic Java development concepts to the latest tools and techniques used in Java, this book will put would-be programmers on their way to Java mastery [/li] [li]Explores what goes into creating a program, how to put the pieces together, dealing with standard programming challenges, debugging, and making it work[/li][/ul]
[i]Download Link:[/i] [code]http://uploading.com/files/9e6c54eb/Beginning%2BProgramming%2BWith%2BJava%2BFor%2BDummies%252C%2B2nd%2BEdition.pdf/[/code]
Read this before you ask a question. ~Nets

item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

The layout of the ‘x for Dummies’ is the worst I’ve ever seen. First you get an index, then an overview of what’s in every chapter, and then another overview. l2bconcise.

item.title: [eBook] Beginning Programming with Java for Dummies
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

I used some type of java for dummies book. You can’t just sit and read it but it definitely puts some training wheels on if you’re a beginner. Once you get done doing the examples in it and you fool around with them you’ll start having ideas pop into your head and make your own shit.

[quote=“Niall, post:7, topic:334526”]I’d advise against this book, I read it years ago and the first 100 or so pages were shite.

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/index.html

Read the official tutorial if anything.[/quote]
Its a little overwhelming unless you know what you’re trying to do or looking for.

Read full topic
item.source: [eBook] Beginning Programming with Java for Dummies
